com.adobe.idp.jobmanager.client
Class JobManager

java.lang.Object
  com.adobe.idp.jobmanager.client.JobManagerServiceClient
      com.adobe.idp.jobmanager.client.JobManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
JobManager
public class JobManager
extends com.adobe.idp.jobmanager.client.JobManagerServiceClient
implements JobManager

The JobManager class is the primary class for interacting with the Job Manager service. For example, you can use a this class when invoking a long-lived process, you get back an identifier value that is used to obtain the status of the long-lived process. To obtain the status of an long-lived process, you must use this class. For information about invoking a long-lived process, see Invoking Adobe Experience Manager forms.

See Also:
JobManager

Method Detail

createJob

public JobId createJob(InvocationRequest request,
                       boolean persistent)
                throws JobManagerException
For internal use only. Do not use.

Creates a new asynchronous job using the specified InvocationRequest object.

Specified by:
createJob in interface JobManager
Parameters:
request - A valid InvocationRequest object.
persistent - A Boolean value where the value false results in the job instance not being persisted.
Returns:
A JobId object that represents the unique job identifier of the request.
Throws:
JobManagerException - if an error occurs during this request.
